notesStmt.note: Short instructions to illuminator visible next to some miniatures
First page for Vespers with miniature lacking between fols. 80 and 81
A superb collection of illuminated vellum manuscripts and works on the art of illuminating, Stan V. Henkels, Philadelphia, 7 June 1909, p. 2, lot 245.
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2039, no. 84.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This Book of Hours was produced in Flanders in the first quarter of the sixteenth century. It contains a calendar (fols. 5r-16v), followed by the Gospel Lessons for John, Luke, and Matthew and the Passion narrative according to John (fols. 17r-38v), the Hours of the Virgin for the Use of Rome (fols. 39r-93v, missing the first page and miniature for Vespers between fols. 80 and 81), the Hours of the Cross and Hours of the Holy Spirit, intercalated, followed by Seven Penitential Psalms, Litany, and Prayers (fols. 94r-132r), and Vespers for the Office of the Dead (fols. 132v-139r). The book contains fourteen large miniatures accompanied by illusionistic scrolls for the text below, representing the Annunciation (fol. 39r), Nativity (fol. 63r), Annunciation to the Shepherds (fol. 68r), Adoration of the Magi (fol. 73r), Presentation in the Temple/Circumcision (fol. 77r), Coronation of the Virgin (fol. 89r), Christ before Annas (fol. 94r), Christ before Caiaphas (fol. 95v), Pilate washing his hands (fol. 98r), Christ crowned with Thorns (fol. 100v), the Carrying of the Cross (fol. 104v), Crucifixion (fol. 105v), and Resurrection (fol. 108r). Additionally, the book contains seven smaller miniatures inset into the text, representing Saint John on Patmos (fol. 17r), the Visitation (fol. 50v), Caiaphas sending Christ to Pilate (fol. 96v), the Flagellation (fol. 99r), the Man of Sorrows (fol. 101v), Deposition (fol. 107v), and King David in Prayer (fol. 110r), 132v - Job in prayer. Unusually, the miniature for Nones of the Hours of the Virgin represents the Circumcision (fol. 77r), while the intercalated Hours of the Cross and Hours of the Holy Spirit contain a complete cycle of miniatures representing the Passion.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Rome
Ownership notes in pencil, John Frederick Lewis
Gospel Lessons from John, Luke, and Matthew followed by Passion according to John
Hours of the Virgin, Use of Rome (first page and miniature of Vespers missing)
Hours of the Cross and Hours of the Holy Spirit, intercalated, followed by Seven Penitential Psalms, Litany, and Prayers
Inscription, in French, "Air lugubre sur le subjet du tableau qui est dans la chapelle de la conciergerie d'Issoudun," eighteenth century

supportDesc.extent: v+141+vi; 162 x 100 mm bound to 165 x 108 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

p.signatures: Alphanumeric signatures for first half of each gathering, A through P, lower right recto; X marks on first leaf of second half of gathering, lower right recto

p.catchwords: Horizontal catchwords, lower right verso, partially cropped, visible at fols. 54v, 71v, 85v, 91v, 99v, 115v, 123v, and 131v

layoutDesc.layout: One column of fifteen lines, ruled in lead; written area: 104 x 61 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Seventeen large miniatures, with frames and illusionistic text scrolls; four small miniatures; illuminated initials and line-endings throughout
17rSmall miniature, Saint John on Patmos
17rIlluminated initial I
39rLarge miniature, Annunciation, with illusionistic text scroll
50vSmall miniature, Visitation
63rLarge miniature, Nativity, with illusionistic text scroll
68rLarge miniature, Annunciation to the Shepherds, with illusionistic text scroll
73rLarge miniature, Adoration of the Magi, with illusionistic text scroll
77rLarge miniature, Presentation in the Temple/Circumcision, with illusionistic text scroll
89rLarge miniature, Coronation of the Virgin, with illusionistic text scroll
94rLarge miniature, Christ before Annas, with illusionistic text scroll
95vLarge miniature, Christ before Caiaphas, with illusionistic text scroll
96vSmall miniature, Caiaphas sending Christ to Pilate
98rLarge miniature, Pilate washing his hands, with illusionistic text scroll
99rSmall miniature, Flagellation
100vLarge miniature, Christ crowned with Thorns, with illusionistic text scroll
101vSmall miniature, Man of Sorrows
103vLarge miniature, Carrying of the Cross, with illusionistic text scroll
105vLarge miniature, Crucifixion, with illusionistic text scroll
107rSmall miniature, Deposition
108rLarge miniature, Resurrection, with illusionistic text scroll
110rSmall miniature, King David in Prayer
132vLarge miniature, Job mocked by his Friends, with illusionistic text scroll

binding.p: Early-twentieth-century blue morocco, gilt stamped decoration, marbled paper pastedowns, bound by H. Zucker of Philadelphia; stamped on spine in gold: "HORAE BEATAE MARIAE VIRGINIS, LATIN MS, XV. CENTURY"

history.provenance: Dr. J. D. Moyreau (eighteenth century?); W. J. Gilbert, St. Louis; his sale, Stan V. Henkels, Philadelphia, 7 June 1909, lot 245 (purchased by John Frederick Lewis for $140, as per inscription on fol. 3r); John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
